job.title: Associate Software Engineer, Product (Remote)
job.description: ltstronggtwhy join usltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtbrex is reimagining financial systems so every growing company can realize their full potential as the financial os were building software and services in one placedisrupting longentrenched institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our customersltbrgtltbrgtworking at brex allows you to push your limits challenge the status quo and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry were committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream we make this a reality by empowering you with the tools resources and support you need to grow your careerltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtengineering at brexltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtthe engineering team includes data it security and software and is responsible for building innovative products and infrastructure for brex and our customers we believe that engineers should accelerate the business through technology and collaborate across multiple teams to accomplish thatltbrgtltbrgtteams are autonomous value inclusivity eager to learn teach and constantly improve how things work the software we build today is the foundation for dozens of brex systems in the future so engineers have a strong sense of ownership and accountability and take pride in their craftltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtltugtwhat youll doltbrgtltbrgtltugtltstronggtwere looking for folks with an interest in building products and tools comfortable in dealing with lots of moving pieces youll be building customerfacing products that will drive direct business impact and shape our longterm technical vision with a highquality bar youll have the opportunity to learn and push the frontier of providing the best financial software experience to help companies grow youll be encouraged to be metric and datadriven and to think creatively to help brex scale and get prepared for the new markets we are about to enterltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtltugtresponsibilitiesltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligtcollaborate with your team to design and build strong resilient and robust apis libraries and tools to power brex engineers and operationsltligtltligtlearn how to scale systems and services as brex grows with our customersltligtltligtparticipate in the full software development lifecycle design development testing operating in production in collaboration with your teamltligtltligtuphold our high engineering standards and bring consistency to the codebases infrastructure and processes you will encounterltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtltugtrequirementsltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligtyou have some training or experience in software engineering and possess some programming fundamentals such as writing unit tests debugging code problems basic data structures and algorithmsltligtltligtyou actively solicit feedback and are eager to learn from othersltligtltligtyou are curious and eager to learn about the systems tools and best practices for building software at brexltligtltligtyou are curious about why youre building software as much as what youre building ltligtltligtyou want to actively contribute to a team and are excited to tackle problems togetherltligtltligtmust obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employmentltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtbonus pointsltbrgtltstronggtltulgtltligtcompletion of a coding bootcampltligtltligtsome industry experienceltligtltligtcoding samples on github or similar ltligtltligtsome experience working in another industryltbrgtltligtltulgtif you feel like you dont meet all of the requirements for this role we encourage you to apply anyways we know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome gets in the way of meeting incredible candidates and dont want it to get in the way of meeting you
